snippet: “Opus Hypnagogia” spans centuries and styles to home in on works inspired by the moments when the sleeping mind and the waking one intersect.
abstract: Ken Johnson reviews multi-media art exhibit Opus Hypnagogia: Sacred Spaces of Visionary and Vernacular Art, at Morbid Anatomy Museum, Brooklyn.
lead_paragraph: “Opus Hypnagogia” spans centuries and styles to home in on works inspired by the moments when the sleeping mind and the waking one intersect.

headline.main: Review: The Morbid Anatomy Museum Presents a View From the Subconscious
